body_html:
I've observed similar behavior using a Titan X.

OS: Ubuntu 16.04
NVIDIA driver: 361.42
Cuda: 7.5.18
Cudnn: 4.0.7
TensorFlow: 0.8.0 from https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.8.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

nvidia-smi reports:

jason@ithaca [~] $ nvidia-smi
Sat May 21 09:47:45 2016
+------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 361.42     Driver Version: 361.42         |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name        Persistence-M| Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp  Perf  Pwr:Usage/Cap|         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
|   0  GeForce GTX TIT...  On   | 0000:01:00.0     Off |                  N/A |
| 22%   45C    P8    28W / 250W |  11406MiB / 12287MiB |    100%      Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
...
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes:                                                       GPU Memory |
|  GPU       PID  Type  Process name                               Usage      |
|=============================================================================|
|    0      3504    C   python                                       11379MiB |
...
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+

Note the 100% GPU usage but low fan speed (22%), low temperature (45C), and low power draw (28W). This is likely related to the GPU ending up in P8 mode, which is a lower power mode. From the nvidia docs:

P0/P1 - Maximum 3D performance
P2/P3 - Balanced 3D performance-power
P8 - Basic HD video playback
P10 - DVD playback
P12 - Minimum idle power consumption

After remaining in this frozen state for half a day, eventually this error was produced:
tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_event.cc:49] Error polling for event status: failed to query event: CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_TIMEOUT
suggesting some relation between this issue and #2117.

body:
I've observed similar behavior using a Titan X.

OS: Ubuntu 16.04
NVIDIA driver: 361.42
Cuda: 7.5.18
Cudnn: 4.0.7
TensorFlow: 0.8.0 from `https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.8.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl`

nvidia-smi reports:

```
jason@ithaca [~] $ nvidia-smi
Sat May 21 09:47:45 2016
+------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 361.42     Driver Version: 361.42         |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name        Persistence-M| Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp  Perf  Pwr:Usage/Cap|         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
|   0  GeForce GTX TIT...  On   | 0000:01:00.0     Off |                  N/A |
| 22%   45C    P8    28W / 250W |  11406MiB / 12287MiB |    100%      Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
...
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes:                                                       GPU Memory |
|  GPU       PID  Type  Process name                               Usage      |
|=============================================================================|
|    0      3504    C   python                                       11379MiB |
...
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
```

Note the 100% GPU usage but low fan speed (22%), low temperature (45C), and low power draw (28W). This is likely related to the GPU ending up in `P8` mode, which is a lower power mode. From the [nvidia docs](http://docs.nvidia.com/gameworks/content/gameworkslibrary/coresdk/nvapi/group__gpupstate.html):

```
P0/P1 - Maximum 3D performance
P2/P3 - Balanced 3D performance-power
P8 - Basic HD video playback
P10 - DVD playback
P12 - Minimum idle power consumption
```

After remaining in this frozen state for half a day, eventually this error was produced:
`tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_event.cc:49] Error polling for event status: failed to query event: CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_TIMEOUT`
suggesting some relation between this issue and #2117.
